intro: Bolbidium heismannianum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spherical berries that turn red as they mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Bolbidium heismannianum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
